messages.content: Nicola Sturgeon wants to hold another independence referendum next year, and Jeremy Corbyn has said his Labour Party won’t even stand in the way of one taking place. So this election could be our last chance to stop that referendum, but to do that we all need to send Nicola Sturgeon and the SNP a message they can’t ignore. Only one vote on Thursday 12th December can make Nicola Sturgeon listen and stop the threat of another independence referendum – your vote for the Scottish Conservative and Unionist Party.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: To stand firm against the SNP's plans for another divisive independence referendum.
Reduce drug deaths by reforming methadone prescription and providing greater access to mental health services for drug users.
A stronger focus on cleaner air in Glasgow to help in the fight against the climate emergency.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Invest in NHS care for Obesity
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Invest in primary NHS care for obesity and formulate behavioural changing strategies to help end the epidemic.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Nicola Sturgeon wants to hold another independence referendum next year, and Jeremy Corbyn has said his Labour Party won’t even stand in the way of one taking place.

quotes.text: Corbyn accused of plot to break up Britain
The Labour leader admitted he could grant a referendum if he was to win the General Election.
Corbyn could back new indyref 'as early as 2021'
